intro: Draba brachystemonia, commonly known as the narrowleaf whitlow grass, is a small, flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of the western United States, particularly in California and Nevada. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its basal leaves are narrow and linear, while its flowering stems bear small, white or pale yellow flowers. Draba brachystemonia is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of high-altitude ecosystems.
